result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Stuart C Lynn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Wisconsin Probation Office today May 27, 2016 or Tuesday May 31, 2016 by 4:00 p.m.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to set up a payment plan through the Clerk of Court.
DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
-Condition time.
-Huber granted.
-Report within 90 days.
-Defendant may serve in Minnesota subject to approval of St. Croix County Sheriff and at no expense to St. Croix County.

-15 days out of County sentence to serve in Minnesota and must complete within 6 months.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stuart C Lynn

records.addlTxt: DE called to request a deferment.  DE was advised that he is approved to mail his request no later than 8-25-17 & was given all info required.  DE then stated he may see if he can borrow the money, but was advised that if he will need the deferment for the following month, he will need to file the request then.  DE inquired about the correct PLC # to make pymts to & was given the PLC #1586, was also advised that any pymts pd to the wrong place, will not be forwarded & that the PLC # is always available on my v/m 24/7.  jaf

Apprs: CO: HWC for SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Liddle.ADA:   Matthew L Hartung   DF ATTY:  Eric C. Thole   DF:  Stuart C Lynn appeared from jail. Case called at 2:42 p.m. Parties met in chambers before going on the record. ADA Hartung recites agreement. Moving to amend Ct. 2 to Misd. Theft. Victims rights have been complied with. Victim is present in the courtroom. Ct. 1 will be a deferred agreement for a period of 4 years. Court orders ADA Hartung to file an amended information by June 3, 2016. Victim has had property returned. Atty Thole gives sentencing arguments. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 THEFT in 15CF596 and DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct. 2 Misd. Theft in 15CF596. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Theft in 15CF596 and will withhold entry of judgment per the diversion agreement. Court finds DE guilty of amended Ct. 2 Misd. Theft. Court will sign diversion agreement on today's date. DE makes statement. Any restitution to be paid to the clerk of court office. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

Count 2 Misd. Theft:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report to WI Probation office today or Tuesday by 4:00 p.m. May transfer to MN. 

- 15 days conditional jail time with Huber. Report in 90 days. May serve in MN subject to approval of St Croix Co. Sheriff and at no expense to the County 

- 15 days out of county sentence to serve in MN. Must complete in 6 months. 

- Court costs in the amount of $243.00 to be paid to Clerk of Court. Set up payment plan. 

- DNA Surcharge of $200.00.
From Atty Thole to SRN with 2 apology letters attached.hml

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Eric C. Thole DF: Stuart C Lynn appeared. Case called at 9:08. Atty. Thole updates the court, there will be a waiver. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 02-11-2016 09:00 am

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Joanne B. or Sheri K. or their residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly,  DF ATTY:  Eric C. Thole,  DF:  Stuart C Lynn appeared. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Waive speedy prelim.  Thursday's and Friday's work better for Defendant.
